meanings.definition: To give up or surrender something
meanings.sent1: She was relinquishing her favorite toy to her little sister.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was relinquishing his weapon as a sign of peace.
meanings.sent3: Relinquishing her seat on the bus, she decided to walk home instead.
meanings.sent4: The magician was like a master of relinquishing objects into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The act of relinquishing control can sometimes lead to unexpected freedom.

meanings.definition: To release or let go of control
meanings.sent1: He was relinquishing his grip on the rope slowly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was relinquishing control to the students for the group project.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be relinquishing control of the situation to the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The wind was like a force relinquishing its hold on the kite.
meanings.sent5: Relinquishing control can sometimes bring about a sense of relief.

meanings.definition: To abandon or renounce a claim or right
meanings.sent1: The pirate was relinquishing his claim on the treasure chest.
meanings.sent2: The company was relinquishing its rights to the intellectual property.
meanings.sent3: Relinquishing his title as king, he decided to live a simple life.
meanings.sent4: The sun was like relinquishing its hold on the sky as it set.
meanings.sent5: The act of relinquishing a claim can sometimes lead to peaceful resolutions.
